Click on a glyph to go to that monster's page.

**dNetHack** is a NetHack variant based on [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). The name stands for **Dungeons and Extra-Terrestrials Hack (DnET-Hack)**. In addition to the usual features common to variants (e.g. new monsters, playable races, roles, and items) it introduces various novel features, including horror elements reminiscent of those found in [the *Call of Cthulhu* roleplaying game](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Call_of_Cthulhu_\(role-playing_game\) "wikipedia:Call of Cthulhu (role-playing game)") (based on the [H.P. Lovecraft](/wiki/H.P._Lovecraft "H.P. Lovecraft") story of the same name).

## Major features

- New roles:

  - [Anachrononaut](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut")
  - [Binder](/wiki/Binder_\(dNetHack_role\) "Binder (dNetHack role)")
  - [Convict](/wiki/Convict "Convict")
  - [Madman](/wiki/Madman "Madman")
  - [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble")
  - [Pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate")
  - [Troubadour](/wiki/Bard "Bard")

- Revised roles:
  - [Monk](/wiki/Monk_revision_\(dnethack\) "Monk revision (dnethack)")

- New races:

  - [Chiropteran](/wiki/Chiropteran "Chiropteran")
  - [Clockwork Automaton](/wiki/Clockwork_Automaton_\(starting_race\) "Clockwork Automaton (starting race)")
  - [Drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#dNetHack "Drow (starting race)")
  - [Half-dragon](/wiki/Half-Dragon_\(starting_race\) "Half-Dragon (starting race)")
  - [Incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier_\(dNetHack_starting_race\) "Incantifier (dNetHack starting race)")
  - [Yuki-onna](/wiki/Yuki-onna_\(starting_race\) "Yuki-onna (starting race)")
  - [Vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race_in_dNetHack\) "Vampire (starting race in dNetHack)")

- New skills:

  - [Musicalize spell](/wiki/Musicalize_spell "Musicalize spell")
  - [Beast mastery](/wiki/Beast_mastery "Beast mastery")
  - [Lightsaber forms](/wiki/User:Chris/dNethack/Lightsaber_Forms "User:Chris/dNethack/Lightsaber Forms")
  - [Wand damage](/index.php?title=Wand_damage_\(dnethack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wand damage (dnethack) (page does not exist)")

- New items:

  - Many new [artifacts](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts "DNetHack artifacts")
  - [Re-balances armors](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Items#Changes_to_armor "User:Chris/dNetHack/Items") (As part of this, [some resistances now time out when obtained from corpses.](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Rule_Changes#Eating_Corpses "User:Chris/dNetHack/Rule Changes"))
  - New [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties#dNetHack "Object properties"): holy/unholy (which is somewhat different from blessed/cursed), sizzling, and possibly other effects.

- Implements new [monsters](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Monsters "User:Chris/dNetHack/Monsters").

- Significant changes to [Devil Lords](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack_Devil_Lords "User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Devil Lords") and [Demon Lords](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack_Demon_Lords "User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Demon Lords")

- When reaching the levels with a Devil Lord or Demon Lord it is not always necessary to fight them. Not all of them block the stairs. Avoiding them may be the best course of progress in those cases.

- Re-organizes and expands the [dungeon](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches"). ([ASCII-Sketch of the dungeon](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Map "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Map"))

- Replaces the Elbereth mechanic with [warding signs](/wiki/Wards_\(dNethack\) "Wards (dNethack)"), [File:Wards dNethack.pdf](/wiki/File:Wards_dNethack.pdf "File:Wards dNethack.pdf"), [lookup table](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/WardLookup "User:Chris/dNetHack/WardLookup").

## Useful pointers

- [Here are some useful pointers for experienced nethack players.](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Pointers "User:Chris/dNetHack/Pointers")

* [How to get each of the alignment keys.](/wiki/Alignment_key_\(dNethack\) "Alignment key (dNethack)")

- [Ascension kit information for dNethack](/wiki/Ascension_kit_\(dNethack\) "Ascension kit (dNethack)")

* When living creatures are killed, they often [revive](/wiki/Revive "Revive") a short time later as "zombie" versions if the corpse is left. [Zombies](/wiki/Zombie_\(dNetHack\) "Zombie (dNetHack)") do higher melee damage, but are slower and can revive if they leave corpses.

- In the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch for each role, [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") is ignored.

* Converting altars can be dangerous in dNethack. The deity of the altar may summon one or more guardians after the conversion attempt is done.

- Sokoban levels do not generate monsters in any of the boulder areas. This means that level 1 of Sokoban is monster-free (unless you bring a monster in through other means) and can be a useful place to read spellbooks or store a cache.

* The "Pokedex" entry for each monster is incredibly informative. Checking new creatures with far-look is a good idea. Information on the monster's attacks and resistances are generally displayed. Additionally a [Stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope") will show the current hit points of the creature.

## dNethack in Junethack

### Xlog trophies

[![OneKey.png](/images/4/4d/OneKey.png)](/wiki/File:OneKey.png) *That was the easy one*: Obtained at least one alignment key.

[![ThreeKey.png](/images/0/02/ThreeKey.png)](/wiki/File:ThreeKey.png) *Through the gates of Gehennom*: Obtained at least three alignment keys (the number needed to complete the game).

[![NineKey.png](/images/5/56/NineKey.png)](/wiki/File:NineKey.png) *Those were for replay value...*: Obtained all nine alignment keys.

### Games played trophies

[![DN King.png](/images/d/d7/DN_King.png)](/wiki/File:DN_King.png) *King of dNethack*: Ascend a game with all the new races/roles in dNethack.

[![DN Prince.png](/images/5/59/DN_Prince.png)](/wiki/File:DN_Prince.png) *Prince of dNethack*: Ascend a game with half the new races/roles in dNethack.

[![DN Tour.png](/images/9/9f/DN_Tour.png)](/wiki/File:DN_Tour.png) *dNethack Tour*: Played a game (at least 1000 turns) with all the shiny new races/roles in dNethack.

**The new races in dNethack are incantifier, clockwork automaton, half-dragon, and drow. The new roles are Troubadour, Noble, Pirate, and Binder.** Convict and Vampire are also implemented, but are insufficiently distinct from their incarnations in other variants to count. Note that you can play an incantifier Noble, an incantifier or drow pirate, and a Binder of any race.

[2014 trophies](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Junethack "User:Chris/dNetHack/Junethack")

dNetHack is a NetHack variant based on NetHack 3.4.3. The name stands for Dungeons and Extra-Terrestrials Hack (DnET-Hack). In addition to the usual features common to variants (e.g. new monsters, playable races, roles, and items) it introduces various novel features, including horror elements reminiscent of those found in the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game (based on the H.P. Lovecraft story of the same name).

  • 2 Other features
  • 3 Useful pointers

    • 6.1 Xlog trophies
    • 6.2 Games played trophies
  • 7 Future features

Major features

  • New roles:
    • Anachrononaut
    • Binder
    • Convict
    • Madman
    • Noble
    • Pirate
    • Troubadour
  • Revised roles:
    • Monk
  • New races:
    • Chiropteran
    • Clockwork Automaton
    • Drow
    • Half-dragon
    • Incantifier
    • Yuki-onna
    • Vampire
  • New skills:
    • Musicalize spell
    • Beast mastery
    • Lightsaber forms
    • Wand damage
  • New items:
    • Many new artifacts
    • Re-balances armors (As part of this, some resistances now time out when obtained from corpses.)
    • New object properties: holy/unholy (which is somewhat different from blessed/cursed), sizzling, and possibly other effects.
  • Implements new monsters.
  • Significant changes to Devil Lords and Demon Lords
  • When reaching the levels with a Devil Lord or Demon Lord it is not always necessary to fight them. Not all of them block the stairs. Avoiding them may be the best course of progress in those cases.
  • Re-organizes and expands the dungeon. (ASCII-Sketch of the dungeon)
  • Replaces the Elbereth mechanic with warding signs, File:Wards dNethack.pdf, lookup table.

Other features

  • Rule changes (Some of this stuff is pretty critical to know)
  • Items
  • Conducts in dNethack
  • A summary of the effects of all wards can be found here: File:Wards dNethack.pdf (spoiler).
  • Sanity, Madness, Insight spoilers
  • Spirits
  • Cults
  • New/changed dungeon levels

Useful pointers

  • Here are some useful pointers for experienced nethack players.
  • How to get each of the alignment keys.
  • Ascension kit information for dNethack
  • When living creatures are killed, they often revive a short time later as "zombie" versions if the corpse is left. Zombies do higher melee damage, but are slower and can revive if they leave corpses.
  • In the Quest branch for each role, genocide is ignored.
  • Converting altars can be dangerous in dNethack. The deity of the altar may summon one or more guardians after the conversion attempt is done.
  • Sokoban levels do not generate monsters in any of the boulder areas. This means that level 1 of Sokoban is monster-free (unless you bring a monster in through other means) and can be a useful place to read spellbooks or store a cache.
  • The "Pokedex" entry for each monster is incredibly informative. Checking new creatures with far-look is a good idea. Information on the monster's attacks and resistances are generally displayed. Additionally a Stethoscope will show the current hit points of the creature.

dNethack in Junethack

Xlog trophies

That was the easy one: Obtained at least one alignment key.

Through the gates of Gehennom: Obtained at least three alignment keys (the number needed to complete the game).

Those were for replay value...: Obtained all nine alignment keys.

Games played trophies

King of dNethack: Ascend a game with all the new races/roles in dNethack.

Prince of dNethack: Ascend a game with half the new races/roles in dNethack.

dNethack Tour: Played a game (at least 1000 turns) with all the shiny new races/roles in dNethack.

The new races in dNethack are incantifier, clockwork automaton, half-dragon, and drow. The new roles are Troubadour, Noble, Pirate, and Binder. Convict and Vampire are also implemented, but are insufficiently distinct from their incarnations in other variants to count. Note that you can play an incantifier Noble, an incantifier or drow pirate, and a Binder of any race.

2014 trophies
